abstract: Wall Street and the Bush administration’s record of financial oversight came under attack at the United Nations on Tuesday, with one world leader after another saying that market turmoil in the United States threatened the global economy, according to The New York Times’s Neil MacFarquhar.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street and the Bush administration’s record of financial oversight came under attack at the United Nations on Tuesday, with one world leader after another saying that market turmoil in the United States threatened the global economy, according to The New York Times’s Neil MacFarquhar.

headline.main: Upheaval on Wall St. Stirs Anger in the U.N.
